intro: Brachystegia letestui, commonly known as the Kipiro tree, is a deciduous tree native to eastern Africa, particularly found in countries like Tanzania and Kenya. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. The tree produces small, yellow flowers that are arranged in racemes, followed by flat, pod-like fruits. It is adapted to dry savanna environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
